author: Chris Graham
title: Ivanka Trump joins Justin Trudeau at Broadway show about welcoming foreigners
text:
News Ivanka Trump joins Justin Trudeau at Broadway show about welcoming foreigners Ivanka Trump greets patrons as Nikki Haley, left, looks on before the start of the Broadway debut of the musical "Come From Away" Credit: AP Chris Graham 16 March 2017 • 3:55am 
I vanka Trump has joined Justin Trudeau in attending a Broadway show that celebrates giving foreigners a warm welcome. 
The president's daughter and the Canadian prime minister, who sat next to each other during the play, were part of a political power-crowd at the new musical “Come From Away” on Wednesday night. 
Celebrating Canadian compassion following 9/11, the story is set in the small Newfoundland town of Gander, which saw its population double after it took in thousands of passengers and crew from dozens of planes diverted when US air space was closed following the terror attacks. One recurring theme involves prejudice against Muslims. — Michael Paulson (@MichaelPaulson) March 16, 2017 
“The world gets to see what it is to lean on each other and be there for each other through the darkest times,” Mr Trudeau, who was with his wife Sophie, said as he introduced the play at the Gerald Schoenfeld Theatre. 
H e also hailed the friendship of the two countries. “There is no relationship quite like the friendship between Canada and the United States ... Our friends are there for those tough times,” he added. Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks to the audience before the start of the Broadway musical "Come From Away," in New York Credit: AP 
The appearance of the first daughter and Mr Trudeau at the play coincided with a Hawaii judge blocking Donald Trump's efforts to freeze immigration by refugees and citizens o f some predominantly Muslim nations. Ivanka attending a broadway show called 'Come From Away' with Justin Trudeau #IvankaTrump #justintrudeau pic.twitter.com/KEZ6yXJkUw — Ivanka Trump News (@ivankanews) March 16, 2017 
T he timing would not have been lost on the audience, which included about 120 ambassadors from around the world, including Nikki Haley , the US Ambassador to the United Nations. 
M s Trump and Mr Trudeau arrived at the New York theatre in the same motorcade but in different vehicles. 
Last month, the pair took part in a roundtable discussion about women in the workforce, where photos of the first daughter's expression as she looked at the Canadian leader sent social media into a frenzy . Watch | Ivanka Trump joins meeting with Justin Trudeau and her father 00:50 
T revor Noah, host of the The Daily Show, commented at the time: "She looks like she’s ready to risk it all. She looks like she’s considering dressing up as a Syrian refugee just so Canada will take her in, like, ‘Let me in, Justin!'" 
Mr Trudeau's warm reception at the theatre was in contrast to the ones that greeted two other world leaders who recently attended the Broadway smash "Hamilton" - Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Vice President-elect Mike Pence . Both received more than a smattering of boos.
